questions.question_text:
A company has an application that stores a high volume of unstructured data and session history. The company needs to scale the application reliably to millions of concurrent users while ensuring consistent low latency.

Which AWS service meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
Answer B: Amazon DynamoDB.

Option C, Amazon RDS for SQL Server, is a relational database service that may not be the most suitable option for storing unstructured data and session history that require consistent low latency and can scale to millions of concurrent users. Therefore, option B, Amazon DynamoDB, which is a fully managed NoSQL database service that can handle high volumes of unstructured data with low latency and can scale horizontally to meet the demands of millions of concurrent users, is a better option to meet the requirements mentioned in the question

Selected Answer: B
Answer B: Amazon DynamoDB.

Selected Answer: B
B. Amazon DynamoDB

Selected Answer: B
unstructured data

Selected Answer: B
DynamoDB as it is unstructured data.

Selected Answer: B
DynamoDB as it is unstructured data.
Amazon DynamoDB
Answer B

questions.question_text: Which AWS services or features can a company use to connect the network of its on-premises data center to AWS? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A and D

Selected Answer: AD
A. AWS VPN
D. AWS Direct Connect

Selected Answer: AD
AWS VPN and AWS Direct Connect

The correct options are A (AWS VPN) and D (AWS Direct Connect).

AWS VPN allows customers to establish a secure and private connection between their on-premises network and their VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) on AWS.

AWS Direct Connect is a dedicated network connection from a customer's on-premises data center to AWS. It allows customers to bypass the public internet and establish a private, high bandwidth and low-latency connection to their AWS resources.

Selected Answer: D
D. Deploy the application on EC2 instances in multiple AWS Regions.

Selected Answer: D
D. Deploy the application on EC2 instances in multiple AWS Regions.

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer for multiple geographic locations.
An AWS Region is a physical location in the world where we have multiple Availability Zone

The correct answer is D. Deploy the application on EC2 instances in multiple AWS Regions.

To meet the requirements of providing low latency to users in two different geographic locations and having disaster recovery capabilities, the application should be deployed on EC2 instances in multiple AWS regions. This architecture provides high availability and disaster recovery capabilities by replicating data and services across multiple regions. If one region becomes unavailable, the application can be quickly switched to another region without disrupting end-users.

Selected Answer: D
An AWS Region is a physical location in the world where we have multiple Availability Zone

Selected Answer: D
Multiple geographic zones, multiple AZ.

choices.B: Deploy the application on multiple EC2 instances running in one Availability Zone
choices.A: Deploy the application on an EC2 instance and set up EC2 automatic recovery
choices.C: Deploy the application on EC2 instances in Multi-AZs in a single AWS Region
choices.D: Deploy the application on EC2 instances in multiple AWS Regions.

questions.question_text:
A company wants to migrate its main application to Amazon EC2. The application must provide low latency to users residing in two different geographic locations. The architecture of the application must have disaster recovery capabilities.

How can these requirements be met?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. AWS Shield Advanced

"AWS Shield Advanced provides enhanced protections for your applications running on protected Amazon EC2, Elastic Load Balancing (ELB), Amazon CloudFront, AWS Global Accelerator, and Route 53 resources against more sophisticated and larger attacks. AWS Shield Advanced protection provides always-on, flow-based monitoring of network traffic and active application monitoring to provide near real-time notifications of suspected DDoS incidents. AWS Shield Advanced also employs advanced attack mitigation and routing techniques for automatically mitigating attacks."

https://aws.amazon.com/shield/faqs/

Selected Answer: C
C is answer

questions.question_text:
A company wants high levels of detection and near-real-time (NRT) mitigation against large and sophisticated distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks on applications running on AWS.

Which AWS service should the company use?

A company has an Amazon S3 bucket containing images of scanned financial invoices. The company is building an artificial intelligence (Al)-based application on AWS. The company wants the application to identify and read total balance amounts on the invoices.

Which AWS service will meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Amazon Textract is a machine learning (ML) service that automatically extracts text, handwriting, and data from scanned documents. It goes beyond simple optical character recognition (OCR) to identify, understand, and extract data from forms and tables.

Selected Answer: B
B. Amazon Textract

"Amazon Textract is a machine learning (ML) service that automatically extracts text, handwriting, and data from scanned documents. It goes beyond simple optical character recognition (OCR) to identify, understand, and extract data from forms and tables."

https://aws.amazon.com/textract/
B: Amazon Textract

Selected Answer: B
b: Amazon Textract
